author: yokem55
content: The requirement for mev-boost won't be active until there are relays that can provide robust and monitorable distributed access, and there are multiple relay vendors in place. Until then operators will only be penalized for setting a wrong fee recipient.

author: yokem55
content: No. Penalties are assessed and voted on by the odao which is a permissioned group of high profile, doxed folks. Just buying up rpl does not give that power. Even the pdao (which sets some protocol parameters like commission and collateral  requirements) is weighted by effectively staked rpl (rpl that is actively collateralizing validators).
